docs.snippet: Mixing related but distinct concepts in lessons has proved more effective than focusing on one subject at a time, though it feels harder....
docs.lead_paragraph: Mixing related but distinct concepts in lessons has proved more effective than focusing on one subject at a time, though it feels harder.
docs.abstract: Tampa, Fla, school district is experimenting with technique called interleaving; educational approach to math that mixes distinct but related mathematical concepts in homework assignments rather than focusing on just one subject at a time; technique, one of increasing number of tools culled from cognitive psychology, has been found effective in long-term, though it seems harder at first.
